column4: hi, i'm trying to mount a windows share on my ubuntu 9.04 machine and everytime I try to mount I get a "mount error(112): Host is down" error.  yet the machine is pingable and is up
i've read though most of the samba docs on the wiki and forums, but nothing is turning up
what command are you using to mount it?
but actually, i've already added the whole string to /etc/fstab
but whether i use fstab or not doesn't seem to matter.  i get the same error
Are you connecting to the IP address of the machine or the machine's name on the network?
I find that the IP address works better than connecting to the hostname
i've tried both.  i have set the hosts file to resolve the name to the proper ip too to no avail
sudo mount -t cifs //10.1.1.3/Callum /mnt/Callum is an example of what I use
but whether i issue the command manually or use fstab, resolve the hostname or use the ip, i get the same error
and in /etc/fstab "//10.1.1.3/Callum /mnt/Callum cifs credentials=/mnt/.cred 0 0" and in /mnt/.cred is "username=username<newline>password=password"
You don't need to put a line in /etc/fstab for it to mount...
Its probably your Windows machine causing problems then
i realize, but to automount you do.  i've tried both.
